newsitem.title: USA: US senator urges soft approach in EU grain talks.
newsitem.headline: US senator urges soft approach in EU grain talks.

text.p: U.S. Senate agriculture committee chairman Richard Lugar Thursday urged diplomacy to avoid a new grain subsidy war with the European Union.
"If we're diplomatically successful we'll stop (the EU) from doing that," Lugar said, referring to the possibility of EU wheat dumping.
"If we don't spend that much time on trade...we'll have some problems again," Lugar, R-Ind., added.
Speaking at the annual conference of the U.S. National Broiler Council, the senator repeated his opposition to the resumption of U.S. Export Enhancement Program subsidies.
USDA trade adviser Paul Drazek is currently in Europe for talks on grain trade and other issues.
